meanings.definition: A play for theater, radio, or television.
meanings.sent1: The school performed a drama about friendship and kindness.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy watching dramas at the local theater.
meanings.sent3: The comedy club accidentally turned their skit into a drama.
meanings.sent4: Life is a drama with many acts and scenes.
meanings.sent5: The drama unfolded on stage, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: An exciting, emotional, or unexpected series of events or set of circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The family reunion turned into a drama when old secrets were revealed.
meanings.sent2: The reality show was full of drama and conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The drama of finding a lost puppy ended happily.
meanings.sent4: The political campaign was a drama filled with twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The drama of the storm kept everyone on edge.

meanings.definition: The art of composing, writing, acting, or producing plays.
meanings.sent1: She studied drama in college to become an actress.
meanings.sent2: The drama club worked hard to perfect their performance.
meanings.sent3: The drama of creating a masterpiece was both challenging and rewarding.
meanings.sent4: His life was a drama, and he played the lead role.
meanings.sent5: The drama of putting on a show requires dedication and passion.
